result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT: Court imposed the DV surcharge, but waived the payment of surcharge due to inability to pay.
Provide DNA Sample and pay applicable surcharge. Surcharge to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Bail on deposit in cases 15CM3551, 15CM1651, and 15CM2876 to apply. Any remaining bail is to be returned.
Court WAIVED all other MANDATORY and NON-MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation if found appropriate by agent.

Batterers Intervention program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Trauma informed counseling.
Court LIFTED the no contact order.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court pro se.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Per agent request, due to defendant being in custody, case adjourned for Probation Review Hearing in Branch 24 for 9/23/2016 at 1:30 pm.
Clerical error: correct sentencing judge added.
CLARIFICATION made to sentencing entry dated 2/19/2016 to reflect correct cost information.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Jody Usow.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, Terrance C., and the defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS to begin today.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation if found appropriate by agent.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Trauma informed counseling.
-Court LIFTED the no contact order.
-Court imposed the DV surcharge, but waived the payment of surcharge due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample and pay applicable surcharge. Surcharge to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Bail on deposit in cases 15CM3551, 15CM1651, and 15CM2876 to apply. Any remaining bail is to be returned.
-Court WAIVED all other MANDATORY and NON-MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. 

*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Letter on behalf of defendant

Probation Review Hearing on 6/24/2016 at 1:30 pm in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Jody Usow.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.    Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Jody Usow.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests time for further negotiations. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24 for a Plea Hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Jody Usow for attorney Colin McGinn.  Order signed and filed.  Case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defendant has picked up a new case and counsel has not received discovery yet.  Court granted request for adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Court reminded the defendant she is to maintain absolute sobriety.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for plea and sentencing.  Counsel would like more time so defendant can obtain treatment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Court ordered the NO CONTACT ORDER REINSTATED.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State informed the Court there are new charges being issued against the defendant and they would like an adjournment.  Defense asked this matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
inal pretrial held off record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/19/15.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Violent Contact order.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Terrance C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Samantha Rae Gerou-Hawley in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
